DataElement.preferredName: Person No Infection Required Antibiotic Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a person does not have active infection that requires antibiotics, substances naturally produced by microorganisms or their derivatives that selectively target microorganisms not humans, as an element of a personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person No Infection Required Antibiotic Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person having no active infection that requires antibiotics, substances naturally produced by microorganisms or their derivatives that selectively target microorganisms not humans, as an element of a personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: No Infection Required Antibiotic Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.:A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact. -- 2003:Required; necessary, not optional.:(an-tih-by-AH-tik) A drug used to treat infections caused by bacteria and other microorganisms.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.
Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.

Substances naturally produced by microorganisms or their derivatives that selectively target microorganisms not humans. Antibiotics kill or inhibit the growth of microorganisms by targeting components of the microbial cell absent from human cells, including bacterial cell walls, cell membrane, and 30S or 50S ribosomal subunits. These substances are used in the treatment of bacterial and other microbial infections.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is the patient free of active
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient free of active infection requiring antibiotics with the exception of uncomplicated urinary tract infection (UTI)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient free of acute hepatitis and active infection requiring parenteral antibiotics with the exception of uncomplicated urinary tract infection (UTI)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient free of active infection requiring antibiotics?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: No evidence of a clinically significant active infection

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an active infection requiring parenteral antibiotics?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient free of active infection requiring systemic therapy or dependent on or currently receiving antibiotics that cannot be discontinued before starting study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text_3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have active infection requiring parenteral antibiotics?
